messages.message: Could I get some help on https://instabase.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/490 ? A user at BofA is attempting to use a PDF file as input, OCR the doc, then (somehow?) regenerate the PDF but now with searchable text vs. being an “image” PDF. But keep the PDF “intact”, in terms of what it looks like. That sounds like… _not_ something we can do, currently? Just double-checking that is true before I let him down gently.
basically, they want to impute the original PDF with the metadata’d info so they can highlight/ctrl+f/etc. — correct? yea we can’t do that.
I vaguely remember using some software or modules to do this to pdfs at my previous job…… but can’t remember how/what software :sweat_smile:
